23Reduction WasmInliner::Reduce(Node* node) {
24 switch (node->opcode()) {
25 case IrOpcode::kCall:
26 case IrOpcode::kTailCall:
27 return ReduceCall(node);
28 default:
29 return NoChange();
30 }
31}
32
33#define TRACE(...) \
34 if (v8_flags.trace_wasm_inlining) PrintF(__VA_ARGS__)
35
36void WasmInliner::Trace(Node* call, int inlinee, const char* decision) {
37 TRACE("[function %d: considering node %d, call to %d: %s]\n",
38 data_.func_index, call->id(), inlinee, decision);
39}
40
41int WasmInliner::GetCallCount(Node* call) {
42 if (!env_->enabled_features.has_inlining() && !env_->module->is_wasm_gc) {
43 return 0;
44 }
45 return mcgraph()->GetCallCount(call->id());
46}
47
48// TODO(12166): Save inlined frames for trap/--trace-wasm purposes.
49Reduction WasmInliner::ReduceCall(Node* call) {
50 DCHECK(call->opcode() == IrOpcode::kCall ||
51 call->opcode() == IrOpcode::kTailCall);
52
53 if (seen_.find(call) != seen_.end()) {
54 TRACE("[function %d: have already seen node %d, skipping]\n",
55 data_.func_index, call->id());
56 return NoChange();
57 }
58 seen_.insert(call);
59
60 Node* callee = NodeProperties::GetValueInput(call, 0);
61 IrOpcode::Value reloc_opcode = mcgraph_->machine()->Is32()
62 ? IrOpcode::kRelocatableInt32Constant
63 : IrOpcode::kRelocatableInt64Constant;
64 if (callee->opcode() != reloc_opcode) {
65 TRACE("[function %d: node %d: not a relocatable constant]\n",
66 data_.func_index, call->id());
67 return NoChange();
68 }
69 auto info = OpParameter<RelocatablePtrConstantInfo>(callee->op());
70 uint32_t inlinee_index = static_cast<uint32_t>(info.value());
71 if (info.rmode() != RelocInfo::WASM_CALL) {
72 Trace(call, inlinee_index, "not a wasm call");
73 return NoChange();
74 }
75 if (inlinee_index < module()->num_imported_functions) {
76 Trace(call, inlinee_index, "imported function");
77 return NoChange();
78 }
79
80 // We limit the times a function can be inlined to avoid repeatedly inlining
81 // recursive calls. Since we only check here (and not in {Finalize}), it is
82 // possible to exceed this limit if we find a large number of calls in a
83 // single pass.
84 constexpr int kMaximumInlinedCallsPerFunction = 3;
85 if (function_inlining_count_[inlinee_index] >=
86 kMaximumInlinedCallsPerFunction) {
87 Trace(call, inlinee_index,
88 "too many inlined calls to (recursive?) function");
89 return NoChange();
90 }
91
92 CHECK_LT(inlinee_index, module()->functions.size());
93 const wasm::WasmFunction* inlinee = &module()->functions[inlinee_index];
94 base::Vector<const uint8_t> function_bytes =
95 data_.wire_bytes_storage->GetCode(inlinee->code);
96
97 int call_count = GetCallCount(call);
98
99 int wire_byte_size = static_cast<int>(function_bytes.size());
100 int min_count_for_inlining =
101 v8_flags.wasm_inlining_ignore_call_counts ? 0 : wire_byte_size / 2;
102
103 // If liftoff ran and collected call counts, only inline calls that have been
104 // invoked often, except for truly tiny functions.
105 if (v8_flags.liftoff &&
106 (env_->enabled_features.has_inlining() || env_->module->is_wasm_gc) &&
107 wire_byte_size >= 12 && call_count < min_count_for_inlining) {
108 Trace(call, inlinee_index, "not called often enough");
109 return NoChange();
110 }
111
112 Trace(call, inlinee_index, "adding to inlining candidates");
113
114 CandidateInfo candidate{call, inlinee_index, call_count,
115 function_bytes.length()};
116
117 inlining_candidates_.push(candidate);
118 return NoChange();
119}
120
121bool SmallEnoughToInline(const wasm::WasmModule* module,
122 size_t current_graph_size, uint32_t candidate_size,
123 size_t initial_graph_size) {
124 if (candidate_size > v8_flags.wasm_inlining_max_size) {
125 return false;
126 }
127 if (WasmInliner::graph_size_allows_inlining(
128 module, current_graph_size + candidate_size, initial_graph_size)) {
129 return true;
130 }
131 // For truly tiny functions, let's be a bit more generous.
132 return candidate_size <= 12 &&
133 WasmInliner::graph_size_allows_inlining(
134 module, current_graph_size - 100, initial_graph_size);
135}
136
137bool WasmInliner::graph_size_allows_inlining(const wasm::WasmModule* module,
138 size_t graph_size,
139 size_t initial_graph_size) {
140 size_t budget =
141 std::max<size_t>(v8_flags.wasm_inlining_min_budget,
142 v8_flags.wasm_inlining_factor * initial_graph_size);
143 // For large-ish functions, the inlining budget is mainly defined by the
144 // wasm_inlining_budget.
145 size_t upper_budget = v8_flags.wasm_inlining_budget;
146 double small_function_percentage =
147 module->num_small_functions * 100.0 / module->num_declared_functions;
148 if (small_function_percentage < 50) {
149 // If there are few small functions, it indicates that the toolchain already
150 // performed significant inlining. Reduce the budget significantly as
151 // inlining has a diminishing ROI.
152
153 // We also apply a linear progression of the budget in the interval [25, 50]
154 // for the small_function_percentage. This progression is just added to
155 // prevent performance cliffs (e.g. when just performing a sharp cutoff at
156 // the 50% point) and not based on actual data.
157 double smallishness = std::max(25.0, small_function_percentage) - 25.0;
158 size_t lower_budget = upper_budget / 10;
159 double step = (upper_budget - lower_budget) / 25.0;
160 upper_budget = lower_budget + smallishness * step;
161 }
162 // Independent of the wasm_inlining_budget, for large functions we should
163 // still allow some inlining.
164 size_t full_budget = std::max<size_t>(upper_budget, initial_graph_size * 1.1);
165 budget = std::min<size_t>(full_budget, budget);
166 return graph_size < budget;
167}
168
169void WasmInliner::Trace(const CandidateInfo& candidate, const char* decision) {
170 TRACE(
171 " [function %d: considering candidate {@%d, index=%d, count=%d, "
172 "size=%d, score=%" PRId64 "}: %s]\n",
173 data_.func_index, candidate.node->id(), candidate.inlinee_index,
174 candidate.call_count, candidate.wire_byte_size, candidate.score(),
175 decision);
176}
177
178void WasmInliner::Finalize() {
179 TRACE("[function %d (%s): %s]\n", data_.func_index, debug_name_,
180 inlining_candidates_.empty() ? "no inlining candidates"
181 : "going through inlining candidates");
182 if (inlining_candidates_.empty()) return;
183 while (!inlining_candidates_.empty()) {
184 CandidateInfo candidate = inlining_candidates_.top();
185 inlining_candidates_.pop();
186 Node* call = candidate.node;
187 if (call->IsDead()) {
188 Trace(candidate, "dead node");
189 continue;
190 }
191 // We could build the candidate's graph first and consider its node count,
192 // but it turns out that wire byte size and node count are quite strongly
193 // correlated, at about 1.16 nodes per wire byte (measured for J2Wasm).
194 if (!SmallEnoughToInline(module(), current_graph_size_,
195 candidate.wire_byte_size, initial_graph_size_)) {
196 Trace(candidate, "not enough inlining budget");
197 continue;
198 }
199 const wasm::WasmFunction* inlinee =
200 &module()->functions[candidate.inlinee_index];
201
202 DCHECK_EQ(inlinee->sig->parameter_count(),
203 call->op()->ValueInputCount() - 2);
204#if DEBUG
205 // The two first parameters in the call are the function and instance, and
206 // then come the wasm function parameters.
207 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < inlinee->sig->parameter_count(); i++) {
208 if (!NodeProperties::IsTyped(call->InputAt(i + 2))) continue;
209 wasm::TypeInModule param_type =
210 NodeProperties::GetType(call->InputAt(i + 2)).AsWasm();
211 CHECK(IsSubtypeOf(param_type.type, inlinee->sig->GetParam(i),
212 param_type.module, module()));
213 }
214#endif
215
216 base::Vector<const uint8_t> function_bytes =
217 data_.wire_bytes_storage->GetCode(inlinee->code);
218
219 bool is_shared = module()->types[inlinee->sig_index].is_shared;
220
221 const wasm::FunctionBody inlinee_body{inlinee->sig, inlinee->code.offset(),
222 function_bytes.begin(),
223 function_bytes.end(), is_shared};
224
225 // If the inlinee was not validated before, do that now.
226 if (V8_UNLIKELY(
227 !module()->function_was_validated(candidate.inlinee_index))) {
228 if (ValidateFunctionBody(zone(), env_->enabled_features, module(),
229 detected_, inlinee_body)
230 .failed()) {
231 Trace(candidate, "function is invalid");
232 // At this point we cannot easily raise a compilation error any more.
233 // Since this situation is highly unlikely though, we just ignore this
234 // inlinee and move on. The same validation error will be triggered
235 // again when actually compiling the invalid function.
236 continue;
237 }
238 module()->set_function_validated(candidate.inlinee_index);
239 }
240
241 std::vector<WasmLoopInfo> inlinee_loop_infos;
242 wasm::DanglingExceptions dangling_exceptions;
243
244 size_t subgraph_min_node_id = graph()->NodeCount();
245 Node* inlinee_start;
246 Node* inlinee_end;
247 SourcePosition caller_pos =
248 data_.source_positions->GetSourcePosition(candidate.node);
249 inlining_positions_->push_back({static_cast<int>(candidate.inlinee_index),
250 call->opcode() == IrOpcode::kTailCall,
251 caller_pos});
252 int inlining_position_id =
253 static_cast<int>(inlining_positions_->size()) - 1;
254 WasmGraphBuilder builder(env_, zone(), mcgraph_, inlinee_body.sig,
255 data_.source_positions,
256 WasmGraphBuilder::kInstanceParameterMode,
257 nullptr /* isolate */, env_->enabled_features);
258 builder.set_inlining_id(inlining_position_id);
259 {
260 Graph::SubgraphScope scope(graph());
261 wasm::BuildTFGraph(zone()->allocator(), env_->enabled_features, module(),
262 &builder, detected_, inlinee_body, &inlinee_loop_infos,
263 &dangling_exceptions, data_.node_origins,
264 candidate.inlinee_index, data_.assumptions,
265 NodeProperties::IsExceptionalCall(call)
266 ? wasm::kInlinedHandledCall
267 : wasm::kInlinedNonHandledCall);
268 inlinee_start = graph()->start();
269 inlinee_end = graph()->end();
270 }
271
272 size_t additional_nodes = graph()->NodeCount() - subgraph_min_node_id;
273 Trace(candidate, "inlining");
274 current_graph_size_ += additional_nodes;
275 DCHECK_GE(function_inlining_count_[candidate.inlinee_index], 0);
276 function_inlining_count_[candidate.inlinee_index]++;
277
278 if (call->opcode() == IrOpcode::kCall) {
279 InlineCall(call, inlinee_start, inlinee_end, inlinee->sig, caller_pos,
280 &dangling_exceptions);
281 } else {
282 InlineTailCall(call, inlinee_start, inlinee_end);
283 }
284 call->Kill();
285 data_.loop_infos->insert(data_.loop_infos->end(),
286 inlinee_loop_infos.begin(),
287 inlinee_loop_infos.end());
288 // Returning after inlining, so that new calls in the inlined body are added
289 // to the candidates list and prioritized if they have a higher score.
290 return;
291 }
292}
293
294/* Rewire callee formal parameters to the call-site real parameters. Rewire
295 * effect and control dependencies of callee's start node with the respective
296 * inputs of the call node.
297 */
298void WasmInliner::RewireFunctionEntry(Node* call, Node* callee_start) {
299 Node* control = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(call);
300 Node* effect = NodeProperties::GetEffectInput(call);
301
302 for (Edge edge : callee_start->use_edges()) {
303 Node* use = edge.from();
304 switch (use->opcode()) {
305 case IrOpcode::kParameter: {
306 // Index 0 is the callee node.
307 int index = 1 + ParameterIndexOf(use->op());
308 Replace(use, NodeProperties::GetValueInput(call, index));
309 break;
310 }
311 default:
312 if (NodeProperties::IsEffectEdge(edge)) {
313 edge.UpdateTo(effect);
314 } else if (NodeProperties::IsControlEdge(edge)) {
315 // Projections pointing to the inlinee start are floating control.
316 // They should point to the graph's start.
317 edge.UpdateTo(use->opcode() == IrOpcode::kProjection
318 ? graph()->start()
319 : control);
320 } else {
321 UNREACHABLE();
322 }
323 Revisit(edge.from());
324 break;
325 }
326 }
327}
328
329void WasmInliner::InlineTailCall(Node* call, Node* callee_start,
330 Node* callee_end) {
331 DCHECK_EQ(call->opcode(), IrOpcode::kTailCall);
332 // 1) Rewire function entry.
333 RewireFunctionEntry(call, callee_start);
334 // 2) For tail calls, all we have to do is rewire all terminators of the
335 // inlined graph to the end of the caller graph.
336 for (Node* const input : callee_end->inputs()) {
337 DCHECK(IrOpcode::IsGraphTerminator(input->opcode()));
338 MergeControlToEnd(graph(), common(), input);
339 }
340 for (Edge edge_to_end : call->use_edges()) {
341 DCHECK_EQ(edge_to_end.from(), graph()->end());
342 edge_to_end.UpdateTo(mcgraph()->Dead());
343 }
344 callee_end->Kill();
345 call->Kill();
346 Revisit(graph()->end());
347}
348
349void WasmInliner::InlineCall(Node* call, Node* callee_start, Node* callee_end,
350 const wasm::FunctionSig* inlinee_sig,
351 SourcePosition parent_pos,
352 wasm::DanglingExceptions* dangling_exceptions) {
353 DCHECK_EQ(call->opcode(), IrOpcode::kCall);
354
355 Node* handler = nullptr;
356 bool is_exceptional_call = NodeProperties::IsExceptionalCall(call, &handler);
357
358 // 1) Rewire function entry.
359 RewireFunctionEntry(call, callee_start);
360
361 // 2) Handle all graph terminators for the callee.
362 NodeVector return_nodes(zone());
363 for (Node* const input : callee_end->inputs()) {
364 DCHECK(IrOpcode::IsGraphTerminator(input->opcode()));
365 switch (input->opcode()) {
366 case IrOpcode::kReturn:
367 // Returns are collected to be rewired into the caller graph later.
368 return_nodes.push_back(input);
369 break;
370 case IrOpcode::kDeoptimize:
371 case IrOpcode::kTerminate:
372 case IrOpcode::kThrow:
373 MergeControlToEnd(graph(), common(), input);
374 break;
375 case IrOpcode::kTailCall: {
376 // A tail call in the callee inlined in a regular call in the caller has
377 // to be transformed into a regular call, and then returned from the
378 // inlinee. It will then be handled like any other return.
379 auto descriptor = CallDescriptorOf(input->op());
380 NodeProperties::ChangeOp(input, common()->Call(descriptor));
381 // Consider a function f which calls g which tail calls h. If h traps,
382 // we need the stack trace to include h and f (g's frame is gone due to
383 // the tail call). The way to achieve this is to set this call's
384 // position to the position of g's call in f.
385 data_.source_positions->SetSourcePosition(input, parent_pos);
386
387 DCHECK_GT(input->op()->EffectOutputCount(), 0);
388 DCHECK_GT(input->op()->ControlOutputCount(), 0);
389 Node* effect = input;
390 Node* control = input;
391 if (is_exceptional_call) {
392 // Remember dangling exception (will be connected later).
393 Node* if_exception = graph()->NewNode(
394 mcgraph()->common()->IfException(), input, control);
395 dangling_exceptions->Add(if_exception, if_exception, if_exception);
396 control = graph()->NewNode(mcgraph()->common()->IfSuccess(), input);
397 }
398
399 int return_arity = static_cast<int>(inlinee_sig->return_count());
400 NodeVector return_inputs(zone());
401 // The first input of a return node is always the 0 constant.
402 return_inputs.push_back(graph()->NewNode(common()->Int32Constant(0)));
403 if (return_arity == 1) {
404 // Tail calls are untyped; we have to type the node here.
405 // TODO(manoskouk): Try to compute a more precise type from the callee
406 // node.
407 NodeProperties::SetType(
408 input, Type::Wasm({inlinee_sig->GetReturn(0), module()},
409 graph()->zone()));
410 return_inputs.push_back(input);
411 } else if (return_arity > 1) {
412 for (int i = 0; i < return_arity; i++) {
413 Node* ith_projection =
414 graph()->NewNode(common()->Projection(i), input, control);
415 // Similarly here we have to type the call's projections.
416 NodeProperties::SetType(
417 ith_projection,
418 Type::Wasm({inlinee_sig->GetReturn(i), module()},
419 graph()->zone()));
420 return_inputs.push_back(ith_projection);
421 }
422 }
423
424 // Add effect and control inputs.
425 return_inputs.push_back(effect);
426 return_inputs.push_back(control);
427
428 Node* ret = graph()->NewNode(common()->Return(return_arity),
429 static_cast<int>(return_inputs.size()),
430 return_inputs.data());
431 return_nodes.push_back(ret);
432 break;
433 }
434 default:
435 UNREACHABLE();
436 }
437 }
438 callee_end->Kill();
439
440 // 3) Rewire unhandled calls to the handler.
441 if (is_exceptional_call) {
442 int handler_count = static_cast<int>(dangling_exceptions->Size());
443 if (handler_count > 0) {
444 Node* control_output =
445 graph()->NewNode(common()->Merge(handler_count), handler_count,
446 dangling_exceptions->controls.data());
447 std::vector<Node*>& effects(dangling_exceptions->effects);
448 std::vector<Node*>& values(dangling_exceptions->exception_values);
449
450 effects.push_back(control_output);
451 values.push_back(control_output);
452 Node* value_output = graph()->NewNode(
453 common()->Phi(MachineRepresentation::kTagged, handler_count),
454 handler_count + 1, values.data());
455 Node* effect_output = graph()->NewNode(common()->EffectPhi(handler_count),
456 handler_count + 1, effects.data());
457 ReplaceWithValue(handler, value_output, effect_output, control_output);
458 } else {
459 // Nothing in the inlined function can throw. Remove the handler.
460 ReplaceWithValue(handler, mcgraph()->Dead(), mcgraph()->Dead(),
461 mcgraph()->Dead());
462 }
463 }
464
465 if (!return_nodes.empty()) {
466 /* 4) Collect all return site value, effect, and control inputs into phis
467 * and merges. */
468 int const return_count = static_cast<int>(return_nodes.size());
469 NodeVector controls(zone());
470 NodeVector effects(zone());
471 for (Node* const return_node : return_nodes) {
472 controls.push_back(NodeProperties::GetControlInput(return_node));
473 effects.push_back(NodeProperties::GetEffectInput(return_node));
474 }
475 Node* control_output = graph()->NewNode(common()->Merge(return_count),
476 return_count, &controls.front());
477 effects.push_back(control_output);
478 Node* effect_output =
479 graph()->NewNode(common()->EffectPhi(return_count),
480 static_cast<int>(effects.size()), &effects.front());
481
482 // The first input of a return node is discarded. This is because Wasm
483 // functions always return an additional 0 constant as a first return value.
484 DCHECK(
485 Int32Matcher(NodeProperties::GetValueInput(return_nodes[0], 0)).Is(0));
486 int const return_arity = return_nodes[0]->op()->ValueInputCount() - 1;
487 NodeVector values(zone());
488#if DEBUG
489 for (Node* const return_node : return_nodes) {
490 // 3 = effect, control, first 0 return value.
491 CHECK_EQ(return_arity, return_node->InputCount() - 3);
492 }
493#endif
494 for (int i = 0; i < return_arity; i++) {
495 NodeVector ith_values(zone());
496 for (Node* const return_node : return_nodes) {
497 Node* value = NodeProperties::GetValueInput(return_node, i + 1);
498 ith_values.push_back(value);
499 }
500 ith_values.push_back(control_output);
501 // Find the correct machine representation for the return values from the
502 // inlinee signature.
503 MachineRepresentation repr =
504 inlinee_sig->GetReturn(i).machine_representation();
505 Node* ith_value_output = graph()->NewNode(
506 common()->Phi(repr, return_count),
507 static_cast<int>(ith_values.size()), &ith_values.front());
508 values.push_back(ith_value_output);
509 }
510 for (Node* return_node : return_nodes) return_node->Kill();
511
512 if (return_arity == 0) {
513 // Void function, no value uses.
514 ReplaceWithValue(call, mcgraph()->Dead(), effect_output, control_output);
515 } else if (return_arity == 1) {
516 // One return value. Just replace value uses of the call node with it.
517 // Note: This will automatically detect and replace the IfSuccess node
518 // correctly.
519 ReplaceWithValue(call, values[0], effect_output, control_output);
520 } else {
521 // Multiple returns. We have to find the projections of the call node and
522 // replace them with the returned values.
523 for (Edge use_edge : call->use_edges()) {
524 if (NodeProperties::IsValueEdge(use_edge)) {
525 Node* use = use_edge.from();
526 DCHECK_EQ(use->opcode(), IrOpcode::kProjection);
527 ReplaceWithValue(use, values[ProjectionIndexOf(use->op())]);
528 }
529 }
530 // All value inputs are replaced by the above loop, so it is ok to use
531 // Dead() as a dummy for value replacement.
532 ReplaceWithValue(call, mcgraph()->Dead(), effect_output, control_output);
533 }
534 } else {
535 // The callee can never return. The call node and all its uses are dead.
536 ReplaceWithValue(call, mcgraph()->Dead(), mcgraph()->Dead(),
537 mcgraph()->Dead());
538 }
539}
540
541const wasm::WasmModule* WasmInliner::module() const { return env_->module; }
542
